text:
'Cangjie programming language_class_subtype_subtype_relationship': 'In Cangjie code language, In Cangjie, a subtype relationship exists between two types where one type (the subtype) is considered a more specific version of another type (the supertype). This relationship is fundamental for polymorphism and type compatibility in object-oriented programming.
Subtype relationships in Cangjie can be established through class inheritance, interface implementation, tuple types, function types, and predefined type hierarchies.'

'Cangjie programming language_class_subtype_subtype_predefined': 'In Cangjie code language, Cangjie has some predefined subtype relationships that always hold:
Identity: A type T is always a subtype of itself (T <: T).
Nothing: The Nothing type is a subtype of every other type (Nothing <: T).
Any: Every type T is a subtype of the Any type (T <: Any).
Object: Every class-defined type is a subtype of the Object type.'

'Cangjie programming language_class_subtype_subtype_generic_types': 'In Cangjie code language, There are also subtype relationships between generic types,as detailed in the Subtype Relationships section of generic types.'
